subject: Re: class cast exception
msgSnippet: classpath: c: work commerce;c: work commerce lib junit.jar; and C: WORK commerce junit runner is the location patch file since my ant script sets the path, i
messageBody:
classpath:
c:\work\commerce;c:\work\commerce\lib\junit.jar;

and C:\WORK\commerce\junit\runner is the location patch file

since my ant script sets the path,
i added
<property name="excluded.props" value="${basedir}/commerce" />
and set the classpath as:
<property name="classpath"
value="${weblogic.jar};${excluded.props};${junit.jar}>


But still the same behaviour.
It looks alright to me.
Not sure why its still failing...

Thanks

--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> yours_jeeva wrote:
>
> > Yes Mike,
> > But I am missing something.
> >
> > I extracted the excluded.properties from the jar and added an
entry
> > for my HomeInterface.
> > And placed the whole file path on classpath prior to junit.jar
> > I am running this tru a Ant Script.
> > So I placed it in Ant classpath also.
> > Still I am getting the same problem.
> >
>
> And your 'patched' file lives in
> c:/whatever/junit/runner/excluded.properties, and the classpath
refers
> c:/whatever before junit.jar, right?
>
> I'm guessing the classpath is incorrect.
>
> Mike
